intro: Phoradendron saccatum, commonly known as the sacrum vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, pod-like fruits. It is often found growing on trees in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
